intro: Sphyrospermum glutinosum, commonly known as the sticky sphaerocarp, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, sticky, spherical fruits that remain attached to the plant for an extended period. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying shades of red, purple, or white. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
